info.title: conjoon/rest-api-email
info.description:
Lightweight REST API specification for communicating with email services, including reading, writing and sending messages. Protocol agnostic. ## A note about Messages: The **rest-api-email** considers 3 different entities which are tightly related when handling messages: - MessageItem/MessageDraft - MessageBody - Attachments Each entity can be identified a compound key that contains the following information: - mailAccountId - mailFolderId - id Additionally, Attachments have a `parentMessageItemId`-key fragment that represents the `id` of the owning message. While a `MessageItem`/`MessageDraft` is considered to be the "root"-entity of a message, implementing APIs have to take care of handling all key information and update related entities accordingly after any action requested. Example:
The client requests the `subject` of a message to change. The server responds with a newly created `id` for the message (e.g. with IMAP, a message can not directly be edited under a UID that persists accross changes). The client **MUST** now consider **ALL** related entities of the message have been updated on the server, and has to apply the updated key information to all entities involved on the client itself, if applicable (e.g. an opened MessageBody in an editor).

get.description: Returns a list of all available `MailAccounts` for the client.

401.description: Returned if the requesting client is not authenticated.

get.description: Returns a list of available mail boxes for the client and the `MailAccount`.

200.description: A list of all `MailFolders` for the authenticated client available within the specified `MailAccount`.

401.description: Returned if the requesting client is not authenticated.

404.description: Returned if the specified `MailAccount` was not found.

get.summary: Get a collection of envelope information of messages
get.description:
Returns a list of all available `MessageItem`s for the `MailFolder` identified by `mailFolderId` belonging to the `MailAccount` identified by `mailAccountId` for the requesting client. The list of `MessageItem`s returned is in the boundaries of `start` and `start + limit`; meta-information in the response need to contain the total number of `MessageItems` the owning `Mailfolder` contains. ### Query Parameters ### `limit` A client must explicitly set `limit` to -1 if **ALL** items should be returned. `limit` is only considered if no filter with the property `id` is found. ### Sparse Fieldset with `fields[MessageItem]` Allows to define the attributes to return with a `MessageItem`. Defaults to `*` which means all attributes of a `MessageItem` are included. To exclude attributes, append a comma-separated list with the names of attributes to exclude: **Example:** _All attributes are included (default)_ ``` ?fields[MessageItem]=* ``` **Example:** _Only `previewText` will be included in the set of attributes_ ``` ?fields[MessageItem]=previewText ``` **Example:** _`subject` and `previewText` will not be included in the set of attributes_ ``` ?fields[MessageItem]=*,previewText,subject ``` ### `include` To include the data of the owning `MailFolder`, use the query parameter `include` set to `MailFolders`. To only return the fields `unread` and `total`, add the query parameter `fields[MailFolder]` set to `unread,total`. **Example:** ``` ?include=MailFolders&fields[MailFolder]=unread,total ``` ### `filter` A **json-encoded** string providing additional filter to consider. Must be an array of filter-objects. Multiple filter objects are considered as logical `OR` conditionals. If the server does not understand the filter, a 400-response **MUST** be returned. To group `filter` as logical `AND`, use Arrays of Arrays. #### Filter configuration - `property`
The `property`-key **SHOULD** be an attribute the server understands. - `value`
The `value`-key **SHOULD** be a a value for the `property`. The format is arbitrary. - `operator`
The `operator`-key **SHOULD** be the operator that is used for comparing a list of data with the `property`s `value`. The default operator used is `=`
(The following examples use json-decoded data for demonstration purposes.)
**Example:** _Getting messages flagged as `recent`._ ``` ?filter=[{"property": "recent", "value": true}] ``` **Example:** _Getting messages flagged as `recent`, **OR** messages flagged as `unseen` with an `id` greater than 1657._ ``` ?filter=[{"property": "recent", "value": true}, [{"property": "unseen", "value": true}, {"property": "id", "value": 1657, "operator": ">"}]] ``` **Example:** _Getting only a specific set of messages based on their `id`s: ``` ?filter=[{"property": "id", "value": ["89678", "45", "98798"], "operator": "in"}] ``` ### `options` A **json-encoded** string providing additional options for the attributes. - `previewText`
The `previewText`-attribute **MUST** be allowed to be configured with:
- `length` this allows to specify the length of the `previewText` to return
The `previewText`-attribute **MUST NOT**, but **SHOULD**, be allowed to be configured with:
- `trimApi` if `length` is specified, `trimApi` requests the implementing backend to read out the complete text before trimming it. This can prevent charset decoding issues, but increases load-times (defaults to `false`).
apply options to `html`/`plain`: If the backend supports it, the client should be able to chose which content type of the message should be previewed. The option `precedence` should be submitted to tell which content type should be preferred. A lookup for the other content type is then skipped.
(The following examples use json-decoded data for demonstration purposes.) **Example:** _Preview Text is returned with a max. of 200 characters._ ``` ?options={previewText: {length:200}} ``` **Example:** _Preview Text is returned with a max. of 200 characters, trimming should be done by the backend._ ``` ?options={previewText: {length:200, trimApi: true}} ``` **Example:** _Preview Text configured to first look up content type `plain`, then content type `html` to generate the previewText:_ ``` ?options={previewText: {plain: {length: 200, trimApi: true, precedence: true}}, {html: {length: 200, trimApi: true}} ``` If `plain` and `html` are omitted, the options configured for `previewText` should be internally get applied to both content types. **Default**: The `previewText`s default setting should be, if nothing else specified: ```json previewText: { plain: { precedence: true, length: 200, trimApi: true }, html: { length: 200, trimApi: true } } ``` ##### Ignored Options if a field is excluded, any value found in `options` referring to it will be ignored.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The index of the first item to return

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of items to return. Only considered when `ids` is not specified. If no limit is required by the client, it must be explicitly set to -1

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: A json-encoded object containing one or multiple sort information

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: The list of attributes to include or exclude for the message item. * retrieves all, * followed by attribute names excludes the specified attributes. Attributes only w/o * returns only the specified attributes.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: A json-encoded object containing additional options for the resource lookup.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: A json encoded array of filter objects to send to the server.

400.description: Bad Request - the client sent a request the API could not understand

401.description: Unauthorized - the client is not authenticated.

403.description: Forbidden - the resource may not be accessed by the client.

404.description: Not Found - if the MessageItem with the specified messageItemId does not exist.

500.description: Internal Server Error - if the implementing API encountered an internal error.

post.summary: Create a new message as a draft
post.description: Creates a new draft for the specified `MailAccount` and stores it in the `MailFolder` identified with `mailFolderId`

401.description: Unauthorized - the client is not authenticated.

403.description: Forbidden - the resource may not be accessed by the client.

404.description: Not Found - if the resource for the specified `mailAccountId` and `mailFolderId` does not exist.

500.description: Internal Server Error - if the implementing API encountered an internal error.

get.summary: Return envelope information of a single message
get.description:
Returns the single `MessageItem`.
The API does not distinguish betweenrequesting a `MessageDraft` or a `MessageItem`, since envelope informations are all the same. It is up to the client to render the information given the specific context (i.e. read or edit).

### Query Parameters

### Sparse Fieldset with `fields[MessageItem]`

Allows to define the attributes to return with a `MessageItem`. Defaults to `*` which means all attributes of a `MessageItem` are included.
To exclude attributes, append a comma-separated list with the names of attributes to exclude:

**Example:** _All attributes are included (default)_
```
?fields[MessageItem]=* 
```

**Example:** _Only `hasAttachments` will be included in the set of attributes_
```
?fields[MessageItem]=hasAttachments
```

**Example:** _`subject` and `previewText` will not be included in the set of attributes_
```
?fields[MessageItem]=*,previewText,subject 
```

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: The list of attributes to include or exclude for the message item. * retrieves all, * followed by attribute names excludes the specified attributes. Attributes only w/o * returns only the specified attributes.

200.description: The `MessageItem` found at the resource location.

401.description: Unauthorized - the client is not authenticated.

403.description: Forbidden - the resource may not be accessed by the client.

404.description: Not Found - if the MessageItem with the specified messageItemId does not exist.

500.description: Internal Server Error - if the implementing API encountered an internal error.

401.description: Unauthorized - the client is not authenticated.

403.description: Forbidden - the resource may not be accessed by the client.

404.description: Not Found - if the MessageItem does not exist.

500.description: Internal Server Error - if the implementing API encountered an internal error.

delete.description: Entirely deletes a Message, including all associated `Attachments` and the `MessageBody`.

200.description: OK - if the message was sent, a `200` status code is returned with the response.

401.description: Unauthorized - the client is not authenticated.

403.description: Forbidden - the resource may not be accessed by the client.

404.description: Not Found - if the Message does not exist.

405.description: Method Not Allowed - If the Message is not flagged as `DRAFT`

500.description: Internal Server Error - if the implementing API encountered an internal error.

post.description:
Sends the message represented by the Path Params. The message must be flagged as `DRAFT` in order for the operation to succeed.

The `POST`-operation does not require any parameters.

Sending a message means that a server-connection configured with the `MailAccount` was established and the data of the message was successfully assembled to meet the server's protocol-requirements for sending it. If the response represents a successful operation, implementing clients can then take care of deleting the sent message from its source folder and/or move/copy it to a new destination folder (e.g. _Sent_-folder), if applicable.

patch.description:
Updates the specific `MessageItem` with the submitted information.
The client can move a message to a different MailFolder by explicitely submitting a `relationships` member.

It is possible that the server decides to store the message under a new `id`. The updated relationships are available with the response.

**Note:**
If fields of a message are updated and its id changes, the backend **MUST** consider the new resource location for all related entities of **THIS** message, such as its body and its attachments. The client has to take care of applying the updated relationships to existing entities currently used in memory, either dynamically or by triggering a complete reload of the updated message.

401.description: Unauthorized - the client is not authenticated.

403.description: Forbidden - the resource may not be accessed by the client.

404.description: Not Found - if the MessageItem does not exist.

500.description: Internal Server Error - if the implementing API encountered an internal error.

patch.summary: Updates a message as a draft
patch.description:
Updates the specific `MessageDraft` with the submitted information.
It is possible that the server decides to store the message under a new `id`. The updated relationships are available with the response.

**Note:**
If fields of a message are updated and its id changes, the backend **MUST** consider the new resource location for all related entities of **THIS** message, such as its body and its attachments. The client has to take care of applying the updated relationships to existing entities currently used in memory, either dynamically or by triggering a complete reload of the updated message.

401.description: Unauthorized - the client is not authenticated.

403.description: Forbidden - the resource may not be accessed by the client.

404.description: Not Found - if the MessageItem does not exist.

500.description: Internal Server Error - if the implementing API encountered an internal error.

cc.description: JSON-encoded representation of a list of EmailAddresses

bcc.description: JSON-encoded representation of a list of EmailAddresses

date.description: client's UNIX Timestamp representing date of creation

get.description: Returns the single `MessageBody` for the specified key fragments.

200.description: The `MessageBody` found for the specified `mailAccountId`, `mailFolderId` and `messageItemId`

401.description: Unauthorized - the client is not authenticated.

403.description: Forbidden - the resource may not be accessed by the client.

404.description: Not Found - if the `MessageBody` for the specified specified `mailAccountId`, `mailFolderId` and `messageItemId` does not exist.

500.description: Internal Server Error - if the implementing API encountered an internal error.

401.description: Unauthorized - the client is not authenticated.

403.description: Forbidden - the resource may not be accessed by the client.

404.description: Not Found - if the MessageBody does not exist.

500.description: Internal Server Error - if the implementing API encountered an internal error.

patch.description: Updates the `MessageBody` of the message represented by the key fragments.

get.description:
Returns a list of all `FileAttachmentItem`s for the MailAccount with the specified `mailAccountId` and `mailFolderId`.
**The fields `mailFolderId`, `mailAccountId`, `parentMessageitemId` and `id` must always be available with the response, for each returned entity.**

post.description: Creates new Attachments for the specified MessageItem.

200.description: The created attachments as a list of FileAttachmentItems

requestBody.description: The form data for an attachment file.

parameters.name: parentMessageItemId
parameters.description: the id of the owning message

parameters.name: parentMessageItemId
parameters.description: the id of the owning message

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the id of the referenced attachment

success.description: Indicates the successful deletion of an attachment.

delete.description: Deletes the attachment with the given id. The data returned is the key of the owning message, containing the **updated key information**: If deleting the attachment triggered the owning resource to change its location, the updated key must reflect this.

tags.name: MessageItems

mailAccountId.name: mailAccountId
mailAccountId.description: An id of a MailAccount that should be targeted for the operation

mailFolderId.name: mailFolderId
mailFolderId.description: An id of the MailFolder that should be targeted for the operation

messageItemId.name: messageItemId
messageItemId.description: The id of the MessageItem that should be targeted for the operation

MailFolder_ResourceObject.description: Resource Object representing a `MailFolder`. Contains a Resource Linkage to the owning `MailAccount` in its `relationships` member.

data.description: List of child mail folders, if any. May be empty.

MailFolder_ResourceObject.title: MailFolder (Resource Object)

MailFolder_ResourceObject_incl.description: Resource Object representing a `MailFolder` for compound documents w/o `attributes`.
MailFolder_ResourceObject_incl.title: MailFolder (Resource Object w/o attributes)

MessageItem_ResourceObject.description:
Models envelope information of message items.
Provides a Resource Linkage to the owning `MailFolder`.
MessageItem_ResourceObject.title: MessageItem_ResourceObject

MessageItem_ResourceObject_incl.description: Resource Object representing a `MessageItem` for compound documents w/o `attributes`.
MessageItem_ResourceObject_incl.title: MessageItem (ResourceObject w/o attributes)

downloadUrl.description: The download uri for the attachment the client understands, e.g. a data uri.

previewImgSrc.description: A computed src for a preview of the attachment the client understands, e.g. a data uri.

size.description: The size of the attachment in bytes.

text.description: The name of the attachment, e.g. the file name.

type.description: The mime type of the attachment.

Attachment_ResourceObject.description: Attachment data to be returned by the API to the requesting client.
Attachment_ResourceObject.title: FileAttachmentItem

EmailAddress.title: EmailAddress
EmailAddress.description: An object representing an Email-address, including the address and a name.
